senses.de: To make something as small as possible
senses.ex: We should minimize waste to help the environment.

Tips.title: Environmental Focus
Tips.description: Often used regarding sustainability goals or practices that aim to reduce waste or resources.
Tips.example: Businesses are trying to minimize their carbon footprint.

Tips.title: Not Eliminate
Tips.description: Minimize means to reduce significantly, but not necessarily to remove completely or eliminate.
Tips.example: The plan aims to minimize risks, not eliminate them entirely.

Tips.title: Emotional Impact
Tips.description: Can describe reducing negative feelings or the impact of stressful events.
Tips.example: Deep breathing exercises can minimize anxiety.

senses.de: To lessen the severity of something.
senses.ex: He tried to minimize the damage caused by his mistake.

Tips.title: Conflict Mitigation
Tips.description: Used in contexts of resolving disputes, emphasizing reducing tensions or consequences.
Tips.example: Mediation can minimize the conflict between parties.

Tips.title: Proactive Steps
Tips.description: Can imply taking actions in advance to reduce the severity of potential problems.
Tips.example: Regular maintenance minimizes the risk of breakdowns.

senses.de: To belittle or underestimate the importance of something or someone.
senses.ex: Do not minimize your own abilities and achievements.

Tips.title: Conversational Nuance
Tips.description: In casual speech, minimize may suggest invalidating someone's feelings or opinions.
Tips.example: When you said it was 'just a joke', you minimized my concerns.

Tips.title: Interpersonal Sensitivity
Tips.description: Avoid using 'minimize' to describe personal issues; it could sound dismissive.
Tips.example: I don't want to minimize your experience, but we need to find a solution.

senses.de: To make a window or an application on a computer's screen smaller.
senses.ex: Minimize the windows that you are not working on to avoid distraction.

Tips.title: Usability Enhancement
Tips.description: In computer contexts, it helps users focus on specific tasks by clearing space.
Tips.example: Minimize all open applications to see your desktop.

Tips.title: Temporary Action
Tips.description: In computing, minimizing doesn't close the program; it's still running and accessible.
Tips.example: I minimized the game to check the time.

Curtail.wordDefinition:
Curtail means to reduce or cut back on something that is excessive or unnecessary.

It is usually used to refer to cutting back on spending, regulations, or activities. For example: The government is trying to curtail spending on defense.

Curtail is used when there is an excess or something unnecessary that needs to be reduced, while minimize is used when there is something harmful or undesirable that needs to be reduced as much as possible.

Cut down.wordDefinition:
The phrase cut down means to reduce, decrease or diminish the quantity, size or level of something.

Cut down is applicable when you need to reduce the quantity or size of something, while minimize is applicable when you need to make something as small or insignificant as possible.

Decrease.wordDefinition:
Decrease means to make something smaller or less in quantity, size, or extent.

For example, if you decrease the amount of sugar in a recipe, it means you are making it less sweet.

Both words involve reducing something, but decrease focuses on the amount or size, while minimize focuses on the harmful or negative effects.

Diminish.wordDefinition:
Diminish means to make something smaller or less important. It is applicable when talking about things that can be quantified, such as numbers, size, or quantity.

For example, "The number of students taking math classes has diminished this year."

Lessen.wordDefinition:
Lessen means to make something smaller or decrease in size or amount. For example, if you lessen your workload, you would do fewer tasks.

Lessen means to decrease, while minimize means to reduce to the minimum possible level. Both words can be used in a variety of situations, but lessen is generally used when referring to reducing an amount or size, and minimize is usually used when referring to minimizing the impact or importance of something.

Low.wordDefinition:
Low means something is not very high or small in amount, while minimize means to reduce something to the smallest possible level.

For example, the price of a product can be low, meaning it is inexpensive. A company can try to minimize its expenses by reducing unnecessary costs, which means they are trying to make the expenses as small as possible.

Low refers to a relative amount or size, while minimize refers to actively trying to make something smaller or less significant.

Reduce.wordDefinition:
Minimize means to make something as small as possible or to keep it to a minimum. It's used when you want to reduce the amount of something to the lowest possible level.

Reduce means to make something smaller or to decrease its quantity or size. It's used when you want to make something less or decrease its amount.

For example, cutting back on food intake can reduce weight.

Minimize is used when you want to make something as small as possible, while reduce is used when you want to make something smaller or decrease its quantity or size.

Trim.wordDefinition:
Trim means to cut off the unwanted or excess parts of something.

This word is generally used to cut off the edges, modify, or refine something. For example, we trim our hair to make it a certain length.

Minimize means to decrease something while trim means to modify or remove unwanted parts of something. Both words can be used in different scenarios, but minimize is often used when reducing quantity, while trim is used when someone wants to refine, adapt, or cut off the parts that are not necessary.

quotes.Text: Cameras help to minimize collateral damage, and very often, without a camera a missile cannot fire. Certainly, without a camera a drone can't function, which means that the very ways in which we wage war are determined in part by how cameras work and whether they work at all.
quotes.Title: American Philosopher
quotes.Name: Judith Butler

quotes.Text: Air is the enemy of most foods and can increase their rate of spoilage. By transferring them to smaller containers, you not only minimize air contact, but you also help keep your fridge organized and easy to navigate.
quotes.Title: American Chef
quotes.Name: J. Kenji Lopez-Alt

quotes.Text: We must start to prepare for a warming world in the same way that we prepare for the possibility of terrorism - by making sure our infrastructure is secure and by working to minimize threats as much as possible.
quotes.Title: American Politician
quotes.Name: Jackie Speier

quotes.Text: One reason we resist making deliberate choices is that choice equals change and most of us, feeling the world is unpredictable enough, try to minimise the trauma of change in our personal lives.
quotes.Title: Australian Scientist
quotes.Name: Hugh Mackay

quotes.Text: Women live in a world where we are forced to consider our safety at every turn. We minimize risk while we maximize activity. It's this constant balancing act that we do.
quotes.Title: American Scientist
quotes.Name: Hope Jahren

quotes.Text: I said as soon as we had a playoff, we were going to minimize the importance of all the other bowl games. I'm not saying it's good or bad; it kind of is what it is.
quotes.Title: American Coach
quotes.Name: Nick Saban

quotes.Text: I would not minimize the digital divide, which separates the computerized world from the rest, nor would I underestimate the importance of traditional books.
quotes.Title: American Historian
quotes.Name: Robert Darnton

quotes.Text: There is no secure data center in the world; they have all been broken into. We can help you prepare for it and minimize the damage when it does occur.
quotes.Title: American Businessman
quotes.Name: John T. Chambers

quotes.Text: My goal in life is to make decisions that minimize regrets. I don't regret anything I've done.
quotes.Title: American Celebrity
quotes.Name: Jake Pavelka

quotes.Text: Don't minimize the importance of luck in determining life's course.
quotes.Title: Canadian Entertainer
quotes.Name: Alex Trebek
